content: “Did Hillary Clinton ever apologize for receiving the answers to the debate? Just asking!” — TrumpTweet during wee hours of April 3 OK. Once more. There are no “answers” to give in a debate. It’s not an exam. There are questions, to which participants give responses (which may be factual or not), and those responses are generally fact-checked by various media. What Hillary received were QUESTIONS believed to be planned for debates she was going to participate in. Two of them. One having to do with the death penalty, and the other having to do with the drinking water in Flint (for a debate taking place in Flint). Even Hillary’s detractors acknowledge that she’s a lady who does her homework. Is there anyone out there on God’s green earth who doubts that Hillary would already have had a stock answer regarding the death penalty, or doubts that she would have researched out and be prepared to talk intelligently about Flint’s water problems for a debate in Flint (where the water problems were sure to be the number one issue)? Hillary didn’t need to know either of these questions in advance, and receiving them would not have altered her debate performance in either case. Why would she need to “apologize” for receiving something she neither solicited nor needed? We don’t even have evidence that she actually read these supposedly damning emails. That said — Trump needs to find some less obvious irrelevant fluff to use as a red herring in a desperate attempt to distract the media and the public from the Russia matter. An issue that’s closing in on him. And he’s gotta be feeling the squeeze.
